errors.networkError: Error while reading network. Please notify me on Discord.
errors.loggerError:
An error occurred while trying to start the logger. Error message: {{message}}
Logger will be restarted.
errors.loggerFailedRetry: Tried to start logger 3 times, but failed. Please try again.

demo.title: Demo Mode
demo.description: Simulated combat events for testing and demonstration purposes

settings.title: Network Settings
settings.subtitle: Configure how the logger captures network traffic

allInterfaces.title: All Network Interfaces
allInterfaces.description: Capture traffic from all available network interfaces. Disable to use only the default interface.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the Combat Logger

important.title: Important: Optimize Your Logs
important.enableCharactersText: We strongly recommend enabling the Characters checkbox in the recording options (click the cog wheel icon). This provides additional character data that enhances your combat log analysis on NodewarGG.
important.followFormatText: Always ensure your logs follow the format shown above the recorded events:
important.formatNote: If you didn't apply the correct format during recording, don't worry! You can open the saved log file and update it before uploading to NodewarGG. Using the wrong format will result in incorrect class identification and data display on the website.

startupIssues.title: Startup Issues
startupIssues.problem: Problem: Logger won't start or shows errors immediately
startupIssues.checkNpcap: Check if Npcap is properly installed:
startupIssues.checkStatus: Check the status message on the home screen
startupIssues.downloadNpcap: If it says "Npcap is not installed", download and install from

pathError.title: "The system cannot find the path specified" Error
pathError.description: This error usually means Python is not added to your system PATH:
pathError.step1: Follow this guide to add Python to PATH:
pathError.step2: After adding Python to PATH, restart your computer

vpn.title: VPN or Software altering your network:
vpn.text: If you are using a VPN or any software that alters your normal network, it will prevent the tool from picking up events during your record session.

outdatedConfig.title: Config is outdated:
outdatedConfig.text: BDO changes its network structure after each weekly maintenance
outdatedConfig.useWireshark: As a backup, use Wireshark to record the session, then analyze the .pcap file later

wrongInterface.title: Wrong network interface selected:
wrongInterface.trySwitching: Try switching between "All" and "Default" network interfaces

firewall.title: Firewall or antivirus blocking:
firewall.addException: Add an exception for the logger in your antivirus

wrongNames.title: Logs Have Wrong Names
wrongNames.step1: In the log display, use the dropdown menus to reorder the names

cantSave.title: Can't Save Logs / Logs Not Found
cantSave.step1: Make sure you've adjusted the names correctly
cantSave.step2: Check that you have write permissions in the save location
cantSave.step3: Try saving to a different folder (like Documents)

safe.title: Is this tool safe to use?
safe.answer: Yes, the logger only reads network packets and doesn't modify or inject anything into the game.

banned.title: Will I get banned for using this?
banned.answer: The tool operates similarly to Wireshark and only observes network traffic. However, use at your own discretion.

outdatedConfig.title: Why is the config outdated after maintenance?
outdatedConfig.answer: BDO changes its network packet structure during weekly maintenance. The config needs to be updated to match these changes. Check Discord for updates.

anyPvp.title: Can I use this during any PvP activity?
anyPvp.answer: Yes! It works during Node Wars, Sieges and GvG.

editLogs.title: Can I edit logs after saving them?
editLogs.answer: Yes! Use the Open function to load your .log file, adjust the names, and save again.

accidentalClose.title: What if I accidentally close the logger while recording?
accidentalClose.answer: A warning message should appear asking you to confirm. If you lose data, you can use your Wireshark recording as backup (if you made one).

help.title: Need More Help?
help.description: If you're experiencing issues or have questions not covered here:
help.whenAsking: When asking for help, please provide:
help.whatDoing: What you were doing when the problem occurred
